intro: Cojoba costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican cojoba, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and palm-like appearance. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a fuzzy texture. Cojoba costaricensis is typically found in coastal areas and thrives in sandy or well-drained soils.
